metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3981 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
A flaw in grub2 was found where its configuration file, known as grub.cfg,is being created with the wrong permission set allowing non privilegedusers to read its content. This represents a low severity confidentialityissue, as those users can eventually read any encrypted passwords presentin grub.cfg. This flaw affects grub2 2.06 and previous versions. This issuehas been fixed in grub upstream but no version with the fix is currentlyreleased.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3981` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

grub-common - 2.02-2ubuntu8.25
grub-coreboot - 2.02-2ubuntu8.25
grub-coreboot-bin - 2.02-2ubuntu8.25
grub-efi - 2.02-2ubuntu8.25
grub-efi-arm - 2.02-2ubuntu8.25
grub-efi-arm-bin - 2.02-2ubuntu8.25
grub-efi-ia32 - 2.02-2ubuntu8.25
grub-efi-ia32-bin - 2.02-2ubuntu8.25
grub-emu - 2.02-2ubuntu8.25
grub-firmware-qemu - 2.02-2ubuntu8.25
grub-ieee1275 - 2.02-2ubuntu8.25
grub-ieee1275-bin - 2.02-2ubuntu8.25
grub-linuxbios - 2.02-2ubuntu8.25
grub-pc - 2.02-2ubuntu8.25

grub2 - 2.02-2ubuntu8.25

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
